summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted on April 7, 2022, with a Federal Bureau of Prisons Communications Technician from the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York. The interview is part of an OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York. The memorandum lists attachments including the interview transcript and related emails and records.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York is the subject of the OIG investigation.

persons.name: Fred Pridemore
persons.context: Sent an email dated August 20, 2019, to MCC New York, listed as an attachment to the memorandum.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Communications Technician
events.description: Assistant Special Agent in Charge and Special Agent from the DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary interview of a BOP Communications Technician from MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Memorandum by Lieutenant
events.description: A memorandum was written by a Lieutenant, listed as an attachment to the OIG report.

events.title: MCC New York Phone Call Record
events.description: Phone call record #104 for August 9, 2019, from MCC New York is listed as an attachment.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The document is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York.
A voluntary interview of a BOP Communications Technician from MCC New York was conducted on April 7, 2022, and was recorded and transcribed.
The memorandum references multiple email attachments from 2019 regarding camera systems, deliveries, and technical issues at MCC New York.
The document contains a list of 10 attachments including the interview transcript, signed forms, emails, a memorandum, a contract, and a phone call record.
The document is explicitly marked as containing neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is for limited official use only.
